com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.transform.row

Class CompositeRowWiseDataTableTransformation<R extends RowWiseDataTableTransformation>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.transform.row.RowWiseDataTableTransformation
      • com.pb.sawdust.tabledata.transform.row.CompositeRowWiseDataTableTransformation<R>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - The type of the row-wise transformations that are composited by this class.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataTableTransformation, MutatingDataTableTransformation, java.lang.Iterable<R>

    public class CompositeRowWiseDataTableTransformation<R extends RowWiseDataTableTransformation>
extends RowWiseDataTableTransformation
implements java.lang.Iterable<R>
    The CompositeRowWiseDataTableTransformation class provides a simple structure for combining multiple row-wise data table transformations into a single row-wise transformation. It provides slight efficiency gains in that the transformations will be performed in a single step, rather than through multiple iterations through the input data table.

    Instances of this class implement Iterable<R>, and will iterate over the composited data transformations in the order that they are applied.

    • Method Detail

      • transformRow

        public void transformRow(DataRow row,
                DataTable table,
                int rowIndex)
        Description copied from class: RowWiseDataTableTransformation
        Transform a given row of data in the table. The actual transformation should be performed on the table (at the specified row index), and not on the data row, which may be unmodifiable or separated view of the data. On the other hand, access of the row's data for use the transformation should occur through the data row parameter.
        Specified by:
        transformRow in class RowWiseDataTableTransformation
        Parameters:
        row - The DataRow representation of the row to transform.
        table - The table holding the row to transform.
        rowIndex - The index (in table of the row to transform.
